001package io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JavaType;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.type.ArrayType;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.type.CollectionType;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.type.MapType;
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.type.TypeFactory;
008import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.BJSL;
009import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.elements.ParsedArray;
010import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.elements.ParsedElement;
011import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.elements.ParsedObject;
012import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.elements.ParsedPrimitive;
013import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.parsers.exception.InvalidTypeException;
014import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.annotations.AlwaysSerialize;
015import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.annotations.NeverSerialize;
016import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.annotations.Rename;
017import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.conditions.ExpectGreaterThan;
018import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.conditions.ExpectIsNull;
019import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.conditions.ExpectLessThan;
020import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.conditions.ExpectNotNull;
021import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.exception.*;
022import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.reflection.InitializationUtil;
023import io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.reflection.TypeUtils;
024import java.io.PrintWriter;
025import java.io.StringWriter;
026import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
027import java.lang.reflect.Field;
028import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
029import java.lang.reflect.Type;
030import java.util.*;
031import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
032import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
033
034/**
035 * An Object processor for mapping elements to objects and objects to elements
036 * <p>
037 * Also has options for reducing the amount of output keys
038 *
039 * @version 2.0.0
040 * @since 1.0.0
041 */
042public class ObjectProcessor {
043    /**
044     * Weather null values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
045     *
046     * @since 1.0.0
047     */
048    protected final boolean ignoreNulls;
049
050    /**
051     * Weather null values should be ignored when serializing lists and arrays
052     *
053     * @since 4.0.0
054     */
055    protected final boolean ignoreArrayNulls;
056
057    /**
058     * Weather empty objects (Objects with a size of 0) should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
059     *
060     * @since 1.0.0
061     */
062    protected final boolean ignoreEmptyObjects;
063
064    /**
065     * Weather default values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
066     * <p>
067     * These are gotten from the value in a new instance of the object
068     *
069     * @since 1.0.0
070     */
071    protected final boolean ignoreDefaults;
072
073    /**
074     * Weather checks for enum names should be case-sensitive
075     *
076     * @since 1.0.0
077     */
078    protected final boolean caseSensitiveEnums;
079
080    /**
081     * A map of object types to type processors
082     *
083     * @since 1.0.0
084     */
085    protected final @NotNull Map<JavaType, TypeProcessor> typeProcessors;
086
087    /**
088     * Create a new ObjectProcessor using certain factories
089     *
090     * @param ignoreNulls        Weather null values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
091     * @param ignoreArrayNulls   Weather null values should be ignored when serializing lists and arrays
092     * @param ignoreEmptyObjects Weather empty objects (Objects with a size of 0) should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
093     * @param ignoreDefaults     Weather default values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
094     * @param caseSensitiveEnums Weather checks for enum names should be case-sensitive
095     * @param typeProcessors     A map of object types to type processors
096     *
097     * @since 1.0.0
098     */
099    protected ObjectProcessor(boolean ignoreNulls, boolean ignoreArrayNulls, boolean ignoreEmptyObjects, boolean ignoreDefaults, boolean caseSensitiveEnums, @NotNull Map<JavaType, TypeProcessor> typeProcessors) {
100        this.ignoreNulls = ignoreNulls;
101        this.ignoreArrayNulls = ignoreArrayNulls;
102        this.ignoreEmptyObjects = ignoreEmptyObjects;
103        this.ignoreDefaults = ignoreDefaults;
104
105        this.caseSensitiveEnums = caseSensitiveEnums;
106
107        this.typeProcessors = typeProcessors;
108    }
109
110    /**
111     * A builder class for creating new {@link ObjectProcessor}s
112     *
113     * @version 2.0.0
114     * @since 1.0.0
115     */
116    public static class Builder {
117        /**
118         * Weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
119         * <p>
120         * Default is false
121         *
122         * @since 1.0.0
123         */
124        protected boolean ignoreNulls = false;
125
126        /**
127         * Weather null values should be ignored when serializing lists and arrays
128         * <p>
129         * Default is true
130         *
131         * @since 4.0.0
132         */
133        protected boolean ignoreArrayNulls = false;
134
135        /**
136         * Weather or not empty objects (Objects with a size of 0) should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
137         * <p>
138         * Default is false
139         *
140         * @since 1.0.0
141         */
142        protected boolean ignoreEmptyObjects = false;
143
144        /**
145         * Weather or not default values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
146         * <p>
147         * These are gotten from the value in a new instance of the object
148         * <p>
149         * Default is false
150         *
151         * @since 1.0.0
152         */
153        protected boolean ignoreDefaults = false;
154
155        /**
156         * Weather checks for enum names should be case-sensitive
157         * <p>
158         * Default is false
159         *
160         * @since 1.0.0
161         */
162        protected boolean caseSensitiveEnums = false;
163
164        /**
165         * A map of object types to type processors
166         *
167         * @since 1.0.0
168         */
169        protected final @NotNull Map<JavaType, TypeProcessor> typeProcessors = new HashMap<>();
170
171        /**
172         * The options for the default type processors, null means disable the default type processors
173         *
174         * @since 2.0.0
175         */
176        protected @Nullable DefaultTypeProcessors.Options defaultTypeProcessorsOptions = DefaultTypeProcessors.Options.DEFAULT;
177
178        /**
179         * Create a new {@link ObjectProcessor} builder
180         *
181         * @since 1.0.0
182         */
183        public Builder() {
184        }
185
186        /**
187         * Get weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
188         * <p>
189         * Default is false
190         *
191         * @return Weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
192         *
193         * @since 1.0.0
194         */
195        public boolean getIgnoreNulls() {
196            return this.ignoreNulls;
197        }
198
199        /**
200         * Set weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
201         * <p>
202         * Default is false
203         *
204         * @param value Weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
205         *
206         * @return Self for chaining
207         *
208         * @since 1.0.0
209         */
210        public @NotNull Builder setIgnoreNulls(boolean value) {
211            this.ignoreNulls = value;
212
213            return this;
214        }
215
216        /**
217         * Get weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing lists and arrays
218         * <p>
219         * Default is false
220         *
221         * @return Weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing lists and arrays
222         *
223         * @since 4.0.0
224         */
225        public boolean getIgnoreArrayNulls() {
226            return this.ignoreArrayNulls;
227        }
228
229        /**
230         * Set weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing lists and arrays
231         * <p>
232         * Default is false
233         *
234         * @param value Weather or not null values should be ignored when serializing lists and arrays
235         *
236         * @return Self for chaining
237         *
238         * @since 4.0.0
239         */
240        public @NotNull Builder setIgnoreArrayNulls(boolean value) {
241            this.ignoreArrayNulls = value;
242
243            return this;
244        }
245
246        /**
247         * Get weather or not empty objects (Objects with a size of 0) should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
248         * <p>
249         * Default is false
250         *
251         * @return Weather or not empty objects (Objects with a size of 0) should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
252         *
253         * @since 1.0.0
254         */
255        public boolean getIgnoreEmptyObjects() {
256            return this.ignoreEmptyObjects;
257        }
258
259        /**
260         * Set weather or not empty objects (Objects with a size of 0) should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
261         * <p>
262         * Default is false
263         *
264         * @param value Weather or not empty objects (Objects with a size of 0) should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
265         *
266         * @return Self for chaining
267         *
268         * @since 1.0.0
269         */
270        public @NotNull Builder setIgnoreEmptyObjects(boolean value) {
271            this.ignoreEmptyObjects = value;
272
273            return this;
274        }
275
276        /**
277         * Get weather or not default values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
278         * <p>
279         * These are gotten from the value in a new instance of the object
280         * <p>
281         * Default is false
282         *
283         * @return Weather or not default values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
284         *
285         * @since 1.0.0
286         */
287        public boolean getIgnoreDefaults() {
288            return this.ignoreDefaults;
289        }
290
291        /**
292         * Set weather or not default values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
293         * <p>
294         * These are gotten from the value in a new instance of the object
295         * <p>
296         * Default is false
297         *
298         * @param value Weather or not default values should be ignored when serializing maps and objects
299         *
300         * @return Self for chaining
301         *
302         * @since 1.0.0
303         */
304        public @NotNull Builder setIgnoreDefaults(boolean value) {
305            this.ignoreDefaults = value;
306
307            return this;
308        }
309
310        /**
311         * Get weather checks for enum names should be case-sensitive
312         * <p>
313         * Default is false
314         *
315         * @return Weather checks for enum names should be case-sensitive
316         *
317         * @since 1.0.0
318         */
319        public boolean getCaseSensitiveEnums() {
320            return this.caseSensitiveEnums;
321        }
322
323        /**
324         * Set weather checks for enum names should be case-sensitive
325         * <p>
326         * Default is false
327         *
328         * @param value Weather checks for enum names should be case-sensitive
329         *
330         * @return Self for chaining
331         *
332         * @since 1.0.0
333         */
334        public @NotNull Builder setCaseSensitiveEnums(boolean value) {
335            this.caseSensitiveEnums = value;
336
337            return this;
338        }
339
340        /**
341         * Get all the type processors created
342         *
343         * @return All the type processors created
344         *
345         * @since 1.0.0
346         */
347        public @NotNull Map<JavaType, TypeProcessor> getTypeProcessors() {
348            return this.typeProcessors;
349        }
350
351        /**
352         * Check if a type processor exists for this class
353         * <p>
354         * Calls {@link #hasTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
355         *
356         * @param clazz The class to check for
357         *
358         * @return If a type processor for clazz exists
359         *
360         * @since 1.0.0
361         */
362        public boolean hasTypeProcessor(@NotNull Class<?> clazz) {
363            return this.hasTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(clazz, new JavaType[] { }));
364        }
365
366        /**
367         * Check if a type processor exists for this class or a super class
368         * <p>
369         * Calls {@link #hasTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
370         *
371         * @param clazz The class to check for
372         *
373         * @return If a type processor for clazz exists
374         *
375         * @since 1.0.0
376         */
377        public boolean hasTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(@NotNull Class<?> clazz) {
378            return this.hasTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(clazz, new JavaType[] { }));
379        }
380
381        /**
382         * Check if a type processor exists for this class
383         * <p>
384         * Calls {@link #hasTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
385         *
386         * @param type The type to check for
387         *
388         * @return If a type processor for type exists
389         *
390         * @since 1.0.0
391         */
392        public boolean hasTypeProcessor(@NotNull Type type) {
393            return this.hasTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructType(type));
394        }
395
396        /**
397         * Check if a type processor exists for this class or a super class
398         * <p>
399         * Calls {@link #hasTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
400         *
401         * @param type The type to check for
402         *
403         * @return If a type processor for type exists
404         *
405         * @since 1.0.0
406         */
407        public boolean hasTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(@NotNull Type type) {
408            return this.hasTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructType(type));
409        }
410
411        /**
412         * Check if a type processor exists for this class
413         *
414         * @param type The type to check for
415         *
416         * @return If a type processor for type exists
417         *
418         * @since 1.0.0
419         */
420        public boolean hasTypeProcessor(@NotNull JavaType type) {
421            return typeProcessors.entrySet().stream().anyMatch(entry -> TypeUtils.isType(type, entry.getKey()));
422        }
423
424        /**
425         * Check if a type processor exists for this class or a super class
426         *
427         * @param type The type to check for
428         *
429         * @return If a type processor for type exists
430         *
431         * @since 1.0.0
432         */
433        public boolean hasTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(@NotNull JavaType type) {
434            return typeProcessors.entrySet().stream().anyMatch(entry -> TypeUtils.isTypeOrSuperTypeOf(type, entry.getKey()));
435        }
436
437        /**
438         * Get a type processor for this class
439         * <p>
440         * Calls {@link #getTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
441         *
442         * @param clazz The class to get
443         *
444         * @return The type processor for class
445         *
446         * @since 1.0.0
447         */
448        public @NotNull TypeProcessor getTypeProcessor(@NotNull Class<?> clazz) {
449            return this.getTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(clazz, new JavaType[] { }));
450        }
451
452        /**
453         * Get a type processor for this class or a superclass
454         * <p>
455         * Calls {@link #getTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
456         *
457         * @param clazz The class to get
458         *
459         * @return The type processor for class
460         *
461         * @since 1.0.0
462         */
463        public @NotNull TypeProcessor getTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(@NotNull Class<?> clazz) {
464            return this.getTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(clazz, new JavaType[] { }));
465        }
466
467        /**
468         * Get a type processor for this class
469         * <p>
470         * Calls {@link #getTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
471         *
472         * @param type The type to get
473         *
474         * @return The type processor for type
475         *
476         * @since 1.0.0
477         */
478        public @NotNull TypeProcessor getTypeProcessor(@NotNull Type type) {
479            return this.getTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructType(type));
480        }
481
482        /**
483         * Get a type processor for this class or a superclass
484         * <p>
485         * Calls {@link #getTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
486         *
487         * @param type The type to get
488         *
489         * @return The type processor for type
490         *
491         * @since 1.0.0
492         */
493        public @NotNull TypeProcessor getTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(@NotNull Type type) {
494            return this.getTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructType(type));
495        }
496
497        /**
498         * Get a type processor for this class
499         *
500         * @param type The type to get
501         *
502         * @return The type processor for type
503         *
504         * @since 1.0.0
505         */
506        public @NotNull TypeProcessor getTypeProcessor(@NotNull JavaType type) {
507            return typeProcessors.entrySet().stream().filter(entry -> TypeUtils.isType(type, entry.getKey())).findFirst().orElseThrow().getValue();
508        }
509
510        /**
511         * Get a type processor for this class or a superclass
512         *
513         * @param type The type to get
514         *
515         * @return The type processor for type
516         *
517         * @since 1.0.0
518         */
519        public @NotNull TypeProcessor getTypeOrSupertypeProcessor(@NotNull JavaType type) {
520            return typeProcessors.entrySet().stream().filter(entry -> TypeUtils.isTypeOrSuperTypeOf(type, entry.getKey())).sorted((entryA, entryB) -> TypeUtils.sortDistance(type, entryA.getKey(), entryB.getKey())).findFirst().orElseThrow().getValue();
521        }
522
523        /**
524         * Create a type processor
525         * <p>
526         * Calls {@link #createTypeProcessor(JavaType, TypeProcessor)}
527         *
528         * @param clazz The class to create
529         * @param value The type processor to use
530         *
531         * @return Self for chaining
532         *
533         * @since 1.0.0
534         */
535        public @NotNull Builder createTypeProcessor(@NotNull Class<?> clazz, @NotNull TypeProcessor value) {
536            return this.createTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(clazz, new JavaType[] { }), value);
537        }
538
539        /**
540         * Create a type processor
541         * <p>
542         * Calls {@link #createTypeProcessor(JavaType, TypeProcessor)}
543         *
544         * @param type  The type to create
545         * @param value The type processor to use
546         *
547         * @return Self for chaining
548         *
549         * @since 1.0.0
550         */
551        public @NotNull Builder createTypeProcessor(@NotNull Type type, @NotNull TypeProcessor value) {
552            return this.createTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructType(type), value);
553        }
554
555        /**
556         * Create a type processor
557         *
558         * @param type  The type to create
559         * @param value The type processor to use
560         *
561         * @return Self for chaining
562         *
563         * @since 1.0.0
564         */
565        public @NotNull Builder createTypeProcessor(@NotNull JavaType type, @NotNull TypeProcessor value) {
566            if (this.hasTypeProcessor(type)) {
567                throw new NullPointerException("A type processor already exists for class \"" + type.getRawClass().getSimpleName() + "\"");
568            }
569
570            this.typeProcessors.put(type, value);
571
572            return this;
573        }
574
575        /**
576         * Remove a type processor
577         * <p>
578         * Calls {@link #removeTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
579         *
580         * @param clazz The class to remove
581         *
582         * @return Self for chaining
583         *
584         * @since 1.0.0
585         */
586        public @NotNull Builder removeTypeProcessor(@NotNull Class<?> clazz) {
587            return this.removeTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(clazz, new JavaType[] { }));
588        }
589
590        /**
591         * Remove a type processor
592         * <p>
593         * Calls {@link #removeTypeProcessor(JavaType)}
594         *
595         * @param type The type to remove
596         *
597         * @return Self for chaining
598         *
599         * @since 1.0.0
600         */
601        public @NotNull Builder removeTypeProcessor(@NotNull Type type) {
602            return this.removeTypeProcessor(TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructType(type));
603        }
604
605        /**
606         * Remove a type processor
607         *
608         * @param type The type to remove
609         *
610         * @return Self for chaining
611         *
612         * @since 1.0.0
613         */
614        public @NotNull Builder removeTypeProcessor(@NotNull JavaType type) {
615            if (!this.hasTypeProcessor(type)) {
616                throw new NullPointerException("A type processor does not exists for class \"" + type.getRawClass().getSimpleName() + "\"");
617            }
618
619            this.typeProcessors.remove(type);
620
621            return this;
622        }
623
624        /**
625         * Get the options for the default type processors, null means disable the default type processors
626         *
627         * @return The options for the default type processors, null means disable the default type processors
628         *
629         * @since 2.0.0
630         */
631        public @Nullable DefaultTypeProcessors.Options getDefaultTypeProcessorsOptions() {
632            return this.defaultTypeProcessorsOptions;
633        }
634
635        /**
636         * Set the options for the default type processors, null means disable the default type processors
637         *
638         * @param value The options for the default type processors, null means disable the default type processors
639         *
640         * @return Self for chaining
641         *
642         * @since 2.0.0
643         */
644        public @NotNull Builder setDefaultTypeProcessorsOptions(@Nullable DefaultTypeProcessors.Options value) {
645            this.defaultTypeProcessorsOptions = value;
646
647            return this;
648        }
649
650        /**
651         * Uses the current settings to build a new {@link ObjectProcessor}
652         *
653         * @return A new {@link ObjectProcessor} instance
654         *
655         * @since 1.0.0
656         */
657        public @NotNull ObjectProcessor build() {
658            if (this.defaultTypeProcessorsOptions != null) {
659                DefaultTypeProcessors.register(this);
660            }
661
662            return new ObjectProcessor(this.ignoreNulls, this.ignoreArrayNulls, this.ignoreEmptyObjects, this.ignoreDefaults, this.caseSensitiveEnums, this.typeProcessors);
663        }
664    }
665
666    /**
667     * Maps this element into an Object
668     * <p>
669     * Calls {@link #toObject(ParsedElement, JavaType)}
670     *
671     * @param element The element to map
672     * @param clazz   The object type to map to
673     * @param <T>     The object type to map to
674     *
675     * @return A new Object of passed type with the values of element
676     *
677     * @throws io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.exception.ProcessorException If there is an exception while processing
678     * @since 1.0.0h
679     */
680    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
681    public <T> @Nullable T toObject(@NotNull ParsedElement element, @NotNull Class<T> clazz) {
682        return (T) toObject(element, TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(clazz, new JavaType[] { }));
683    }
684
685    /**
686     * Maps this element into an Object
687     * <p>
688     * Calls {@link #toObject(ParsedElement, JavaType)}
689     *
690     * @param element The element to map
691     * @param type    The object type to map to
692     *
693     * @return A new Object of passed type with the values of element
694     *
695     * @throws io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.exception.ProcessorException If there is an exception while processing
696     * @since 1.0.0
697     */
698    public @Nullable Object toObject(@NotNull ParsedElement element, @NotNull Type type) {
699        return toObject(element, TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructType(type));
700    }
701
702    /**
703     * Maps this element into an Object
704     *
705     * @param element The element to map
706     * @param type    The object type to map to
707     *
708     * @return A new Object of passed type with the values of element
709     *
710     * @throws io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.exception.ProcessorException If there is an exception while processing
711     * @since 1.0.0
712     */
713    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
714    public @Nullable Object toObject(@NotNull ParsedElement element, @NotNull JavaType type) {
715        try {
716            if (element.isPrimitive() && element.asPrimitive().isNull()) {
717                return null;
718            }
719
720            {
721                Optional<TypeProcessor> typeProcessor = typeProcessors.entrySet().stream().filter(entry -> TypeUtils.isTypeOrSuperTypeOf(type, entry.getKey())).sorted((entryA, entryB) -> TypeUtils.sortDistance(type, entryA.getKey(), entryB.getKey())).map(Map.Entry::getValue).findFirst();
722                if (typeProcessor.isPresent()) {
723                    return typeProcessor.get().toObject(element);
724                }
725            }
726
727            if (element instanceof ParsedPrimitive) {
728                if (type.getRawClass().isEnum()) {
729                    if (element.asPrimitive().isString()) {
730                        for (Object value : type.getRawClass().getEnumConstants()) {
731                            if ((!caseSensitiveEnums && ((Enum<?>) value).name().equalsIgnoreCase(element.asPrimitive().asString())) || (caseSensitiveEnums && ((Enum<?>) value).name().equals(element.asPrimitive().asString()))) {
732                                return value;
733                            }
734                        }
735
736                        if (BJSL.getLogger() != null) {
737                            BJSL.getLogger().warning("Unknown enum value \"" + element.asPrimitive().asString() + "\" for type \"" + type.getRawClass().getSimpleName() + "\"");
738                        }
739
740                        return null;
741                    } else {
742                        throw new EnumExpectedException(type.getRawClass());
743                    }
744                } else {
745                    Object object = element.asPrimitive().get();
746
747                    if (object == null) {
748                        return null;
749                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == String.class) {
750                        return object.toString();
751                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Byte.class || type.getRawClass() == byte.class) {
752                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
753                            return Byte.parseByte((String) object);
754                        } else if (object.getClass() == Character.class) {
755                            return (byte) (char) object;
756                        } else if (object.getClass() == Short.class) {
757                            return (byte) (short) object;
758                        } else if (object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
759                            return (byte) (int) object;
760                        } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
761                            return (byte) (long) object;
762                        } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
763                            return (byte) (float) object;
764                        } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
765                            return (byte) (double) object;
766                        } else {
767                            return (byte) object;
768                        }
769                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Character.class || type.getRawClass() == char.class) {
770                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
771                            return ((String) object).charAt(0);
772                        } else if (object.getClass() == Byte.class) {
773                            return (char) (byte) object;
774                        } else if (object.getClass() == Short.class) {
775                            return (char) (short) object;
776                        } else if (object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
777                            return (char) (int) object;
778                        } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
779                            return (char) (long) object;
780                        } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
781                            return (char) (float) object;
782                        } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
783                            return (char) (double) object;
784                        } else {
785                            return (char) object;
786                        }
787                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Short.class || type.getRawClass() == short.class) {
788                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
789                            return Short.parseShort((String) object);
790                        } else if (object.getClass() == Byte.class) {
791                            return (short) (byte) object;
792                        } else if (object.getClass() == Character.class) {
793                            return (short) (char) object;
794                        } else if (object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
795                            return (short) (int) object;
796                        } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
797                            return (short) (long) object;
798                        } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
799                            return (short) (float) object;
800                        } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
801                            return (short) (double) object;
802                        } else {
803                            return (short) object;
804                        }
805                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Integer.class || type.getRawClass() == int.class) {
806                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
807                            return Integer.parseInt((String) object);
808                        } else if (object.getClass() == Byte.class) {
809                            return (int) (byte) object;
810                        } else if (object.getClass() == Character.class) {
811                            return (int) (char) object;
812                        } else if (object.getClass() == Short.class) {
813                            return (int) (short) object;
814                        } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
815                            return (int) (long) object;
816                        } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
817                            return (int) (float) object;
818                        } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
819                            return (int) (double) object;
820                        } else {
821                            return (int) object;
822                        }
823                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Long.class || type.getRawClass() == long.class) {
824                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
825                            return Long.parseLong((String) object);
826                        } else if (object.getClass() == Byte.class) {
827                            return (long) (byte) object;
828                        } else if (object.getClass() == Character.class) {
829                            return (long) (char) object;
830                        } else if (object.getClass() == Short.class) {
831                            return (long) (short) object;
832                        } else if (object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
833                            return (long) (int) object;
834                        } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
835                            return (long) (float) object;
836                        } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
837                            return (long) (double) object;
838                        } else {
839                            return (long) object;
840                        }
841                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Float.class || type.getRawClass() == float.class) {
842                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
843                            return Float.parseFloat((String) object);
844                        } else if (object.getClass() == Byte.class) {
845                            return (float) (byte) object;
846                        } else if (object.getClass() == Character.class) {
847                            return (float) (char) object;
848                        } else if (object.getClass() == Short.class) {
849                            return (float) (short) object;
850                        } else if (object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
851                            return (float) (int) object;
852                        } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
853                            return (float) (long) object;
854                        } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
855                            return (float) (double) object;
856                        } else {
857                            return (float) object;
858                        }
859                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Double.class || type.getRawClass() == double.class) {
860                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
861                            return Double.parseDouble((String) object);
862                        } else if (object.getClass() == Byte.class) {
863                            return (double) (byte) object;
864                        } else if (object.getClass() == Character.class) {
865                            return (double) (char) object;
866                        } else if (object.getClass() == Short.class) {
867                            return (double) (short) object;
868                        } else if (object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
869                            return (double) (int) object;
870                        } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
871                            return (double) (long) object;
872                        } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
873                            return (double) (float) object;
874                        } else {
875                            return (double) object;
876                        }
877                    } else if (type.getRawClass() == Boolean.class || type.getRawClass() == boolean.class) {
878                        if (object.getClass() == String.class) {
879                            return Boolean.parseBoolean((String) object);
880                        } else {
881                            return (boolean) object;
882                        }
883                    } else {
884                        if (BJSL.getLogger() != null) {
885                            BJSL.getLogger().severe("Something went wrong! Primitive was passed to a non primitive type");
886                        }
887
888                        return null;
889                    }
890                }
891            } else if (!type.getRawClass().isAnonymousClass() && !type.getRawClass().isAnnotation()) {
892                switch (element) {
893                    case ParsedObject parsedObject -> {
894                        if (type instanceof MapType) {
895                            Map<Object, Object> object;
896                            if (!type.getRawClass().isInterface()) {
897                                object = (Map<Object, Object>) InitializationUtil.initialize(type.getRawClass());
898                            } else {
899                                object = InitializationUtil.initialize(LinkedHashMap.class);
900                            }
901
902                            for (Map.Entry<String, ParsedElement> entry : element.asObject().getEntries()) {
903                                Object subObject = toObject(entry.getValue(), type.getContentType());
904                                if (!((ignoreNulls && subObject == null) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Object[] objects && objects.length == 0) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Collection<?> collection && collection.isEmpty()) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Map<?, ?> map && map.isEmpty()))) {
905                                    object.put(toObject(ParsedPrimitive.fromString(entry.getKey()), type.getKeyType()), subObject);
906                                }
907                            }
908
909                            return object;
910                        } else if (!type.getRawClass().isInterface()) {
911                            Object object = InitializationUtil.initialize(type.getRawClass());
912
913                            List<Field> fields = getFields(object.getClass());
914                            for (Field field : fields) {
915                                if (!Modifier.isStatic(field.getModifiers()) && (field.canAccess(object) || field.trySetAccessible())) {
916                                    boolean shouldSerialize = !(Modifier.isTransient(field.getModifiers()) || field.getName().startsWith("this$"));
917
918                                    String subKey = field.getName();
919                                    boolean expect = false;
920
921                                    for (Annotation annotation : field.getDeclaredAnnotations()) {
922                                        if (annotation.annotationType() == AlwaysSerialize.class) {
923                                            shouldSerialize = true;
924                                        } else if (annotation.annotationType() == NeverSerialize.class) {
925                                            shouldSerialize = false;
926                                        } else if (annotation.annotationType() == Rename.class) {
927                                            subKey = ((Rename) annotation).value();
928                                        } else if (annotation.annotationType() == ExpectNotNull.class || annotation.annotationType() == ExpectIsNull.class || annotation.annotationType() == ExpectGreaterThan.class || annotation.annotationType() == ExpectLessThan.class) {
929                                            expect = true;
930                                        }
931                                    }
932
933                                    if (shouldSerialize && element.asObject().has(subKey)) {
934                                        Object subObject = toObject(element.asObject().get(subKey), field.getGenericType());
935
936                                        if (expect) {
937                                            for (Annotation annotation : field.getDeclaredAnnotations()) {
938                                                if (annotation.annotationType() == ExpectNotNull.class) {
939                                                    if (subObject == null) {
940                                                        throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " != null");
941                                                    }
942                                                } else if (annotation.annotationType() == ExpectIsNull.class) {
943                                                    if (subObject != null) {
944                                                        throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " == null");
945                                                    }
946                                                } else if (annotation.annotationType() == ExpectGreaterThan.class) {
947                                                    if (object.getClass() == Byte.class || object.getClass() == Short.class || object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
948                                                        if (subObject == null || (int) subObject > (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).intValue() - (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
949                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " >" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).intValue());
950                                                        }
951                                                    } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
952                                                        if (subObject == null || (long) subObject > (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).longValue() - (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
953                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " >" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).longValue());
954                                                        }
955                                                    } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
956                                                        if (subObject == null || (float) subObject > (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).floatValue() - (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
957                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " >" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).floatValue());
958                                                        }
959                                                    } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
960                                                        if (subObject == null || (double) subObject > (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).doubleValue() - (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
961                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " >" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).doubleValue());
962                                                        }
963                                                    } else {
964                                                        throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " is not a number");
965                                                    }
966                                                } else if (annotation.annotationType() == ExpectLessThan.class) {
967                                                    if (object.getClass() == Byte.class || object.getClass() == Short.class || object.getClass() == Integer.class) {
968                                                        if (subObject == null || (int) subObject < (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).intValue() + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
969                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " <" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).intValue());
970                                                        }
971                                                    } else if (object.getClass() == Long.class) {
972                                                        if (subObject == null || (long) subObject < (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).longValue() + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
973                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " <" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).longValue());
974                                                        }
975                                                    } else if (object.getClass() == Float.class) {
976                                                        if (subObject == null || (float) subObject < (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).floatValue() + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
977                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " <" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).floatValue());
978                                                        }
979                                                    } else if (object.getClass() == Double.class) {
980                                                        if (subObject == null || (double) subObject < (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).doubleValue() + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? 1 : 0))) {
981                                                            throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " <" + (((ExpectLessThan) annotation).orEqual() ? "=" : "") + " " + ((ExpectLessThan) annotation).doubleValue());
982                                                        }
983                                                    } else {
984                                                        throw new ExpectFailedException(subKey + " is not a number");
985                                                    }
986                                                }
987                                            }
988                                        }
989
990                                        if (!((ignoreNulls && subObject == null) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Object[] objects && objects.length == 0) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Collection<?> collection && collection.isEmpty()) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Map<?, ?> map && map.isEmpty()))) {
991                                            field.set(object, subObject);
992                                        }
993                                    }
994                                }
995                            }
996
997                            return object;
998                        } else {
999                            throw new InvalidTypeException(type.getRawClass());
1000                        }
1001                    }
1002                    case ParsedArray parsedArray -> {
1003                        if (type instanceof CollectionType) {
1004                            Collection<Object> object;
1005                            if (!type.getRawClass().isInterface()) {
1006                                object = (Collection<Object>) InitializationUtil.initialize(type.getRawClass());
1007                            } else {
1008                                object = InitializationUtil.initialize(LinkedList.class);
1009                            }
1010
1011                            for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1012                                Object subObject = toObject(subElement, type.getContentType());
1013                                if (!((ignoreArrayNulls && subObject == null) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Object[] objects && objects.length == 0) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Collection<?> collection && collection.isEmpty()) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Map<?, ?> map && map.isEmpty()))) {
1014                                    object.add(subObject);
1015                                }
1016                            }
1017
1018                            return object;
1019                        } else if (type instanceof ArrayType) {
1020                            if (type.getRawClass() == byte[].class) {
1021                                byte[] array = (byte[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(byte.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1022
1023                                int i = 0;
1024                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1025                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, byte.class);
1026                                    array[i] = (byte) (subObject != null ? subObject : 0);
1027
1028                                    i++;
1029                                }
1030
1031                                return array;
1032                            } else if (type.getRawClass() == char[].class) {
1033                                char[] array = (char[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(char.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1034
1035                                int i = 0;
1036                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1037                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, char.class);
1038                                    array[i] = (char) (subObject != null ? subObject : 0);
1039
1040                                    i++;
1041                                }
1042
1043                                return array;
1044                            } else if (type.getRawClass() == short[].class) {
1045                                short[] array = (short[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(short.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1046
1047                                int i = 0;
1048                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1049                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, short.class);
1050                                    array[i] = (short) (subObject != null ? subObject : 0);
1051
1052                                    i++;
1053                                }
1054
1055                                return array;
1056                            } else if (type.getRawClass() == int[].class) {
1057                                int[] array = (int[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(int.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1058
1059                                int i = 0;
1060                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1061                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, int.class);
1062                                    array[i] = (int) (subObject != null ? subObject : 0);
1063
1064                                    i++;
1065                                }
1066
1067                                return array;
1068                            } else if (type.getRawClass() == long[].class) {
1069                                long[] array = (long[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(long.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1070
1071                                int i = 0;
1072                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1073                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, long.class);
1074                                    array[i] = (long) (subObject != null ? subObject : 0L);
1075
1076                                    i++;
1077                                }
1078
1079                                return array;
1080                            } else if (type.getRawClass() == float[].class) {
1081                                float[] array = (float[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(float.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1082
1083                                int i = 0;
1084                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1085                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, float.class);
1086                                    array[i] = (float) (subObject != null ? subObject : 0.0f);
1087
1088                                    i++;
1089                                }
1090
1091                                return array;
1092                            } else if (type.getRawClass() == double[].class) {
1093                                double[] array = (double[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(double.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1094
1095                                int i = 0;
1096                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1097                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, double.class);
1098                                    array[i] = (double) (subObject != null ? subObject : 0.0d);
1099
1100                                    i++;
1101                                }
1102
1103                                return array;
1104                            } else if (type.getRawClass() == boolean[].class) {
1105                                boolean[] array = (boolean[]) InitializationUtil.initializePrimitiveArray(boolean.class, element.asArray().getSize());
1106
1107                                int i = 0;
1108                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1109                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, boolean.class);
1110                                    array[i] = (boolean) (subObject != null ? subObject : false);
1111
1112                                    i++;
1113                                }
1114
1115                                return array;
1116                            } else {
1117                                int size = element.asArray().getSize();
1118
1119                                if (ignoreArrayNulls || ignoreEmptyObjects) {
1120                                    size = 0;
1121
1122                                    for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1123                                        Object subObject = toObject(subElement, type.getContentType().getRawClass());
1124                                        if (!((ignoreArrayNulls && subObject == null) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Object[] objects && objects.length == 0) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Collection<?> collection && collection.isEmpty()) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Map<?, ?> map && map.isEmpty()))) {
1125                                            size++;
1126                                        }
1127                                    }
1128                                }
1129
1130                                Object[] array = InitializationUtil.initializeArray(type.getContentType().getRawClass(), size);
1131
1132                                int i = 0;
1133                                for (ParsedElement subElement : element.asArray().getValues()) {
1134                                    Object subObject = toObject(subElement, type.getContentType().getRawClass());
1135                                    if (!((ignoreArrayNulls && subObject == null) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Object[] objects && objects.length == 0) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Collection<?> collection && collection.isEmpty()) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && subObject instanceof Map<?, ?> map && map.isEmpty()))) {
1136                                        array[i] = subObject;
1137
1138                                        i++;
1139                                    }
1140                                }
1141
1142                                return array;
1143                            }
1144                        } else {
1145                            throw new InvalidTypeException(type.getRawClass());
1146                        }
1147                    }
1148                    default -> {
1149                        throw new InvalidTypeException(type.getRawClass());
1150                    }
1151                }
1152            } else {
1153                throw new InvalidTypeException(type.getRawClass());
1154            }
1155        } catch (Exception e) {
1156            throw new ProcessorException(e);
1157        }
1158    }
1159
1160    /**
1161     * Maps this Object into a {@link io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.elements.ParsedElement}
1162     *
1163     * @param object The object to map
1164     *
1165     * @return A new {@link io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.elements.ParsedElement} with the values of object
1166     *
1167     * @throws io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.exception.ProcessorException If there is an exception while processing
1168     * @since 1.0.0
1169     */
1170    public @NotNull ParsedElement toElement(@Nullable Object object) {
1171        try {
1172            if (object == null) {
1173                return ParsedPrimitive.fromNull();
1174            }
1175
1176            try {
1177                JavaType type = TypeFactory.defaultInstance().constructSimpleType(object.getClass(), new JavaType[] { });
1178
1179                Optional<TypeProcessor> typeProcessor = typeProcessors.entrySet().stream().filter(entry -> TypeUtils.isTypeOrSuperTypeOf(type, entry.getKey())).sorted((entryA, entryB) -> TypeUtils.sortDistance(type, entryA.getKey(), entryB.getKey())).map(Map.Entry::getValue).findFirst();
1180                if (typeProcessor.isPresent()) {
1181                    return typeProcessor.get().toElement(object);
1182                }
1183            } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
1184                // Class has type parameters, continue
1185            }
1186
1187            try {
1188                return ParsedPrimitive.from(object);
1189            } catch (ClassCastException e) {
1190                // Not a primitive, continue
1191            }
1192
1193            switch (object) {
1194                case Enum<?> anEnum -> {
1195                    return ParsedPrimitive.fromString(anEnum.name());
1196                }
1197                case byte[] bytes -> {
1198                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1199
1200                    for (byte item : bytes) {
1201                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1202                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1203                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1204                        }
1205                    }
1206
1207                    return arrayElement;
1208                }
1209                case char[] chars -> {
1210                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1211
1212                    for (char item : chars) {
1213                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1214                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1215                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1216                        }
1217                    }
1218
1219                    return arrayElement;
1220                }
1221                case short[] shorts -> {
1222                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1223
1224                    for (short item : shorts) {
1225                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1226                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1227                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1228                        }
1229                    }
1230
1231                    return arrayElement;
1232                }
1233                case int[] integers -> {
1234                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1235
1236                    for (int item : integers) {
1237                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1238                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1239                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1240                        }
1241                    }
1242
1243                    return arrayElement;
1244                }
1245                case long[] longs -> {
1246                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1247
1248                    for (long item : longs) {
1249                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1250                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1251                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1252                        }
1253                    }
1254
1255                    return arrayElement;
1256                }
1257                case float[] floats -> {
1258                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1259
1260                    for (float item : floats) {
1261                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1262                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1263                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1264                        }
1265                    }
1266
1267                    return arrayElement;
1268                }
1269                case double[] doubles -> {
1270                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1271
1272                    for (double item : doubles) {
1273                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1274                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1275                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1276                        }
1277                    }
1278
1279                    return arrayElement;
1280                }
1281                case boolean[] booleans -> {
1282                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1283
1284                    for (boolean item : booleans) {
1285                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1286                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1287                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1288                        }
1289                    }
1290
1291                    return arrayElement;
1292                }
1293                case Object[] objects -> {
1294                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1295
1296                    for (Object item : objects) {
1297                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1298                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1299                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1300                        }
1301                    }
1302
1303                    return arrayElement;
1304                }
1305                case Collection<?> objects -> {
1306                    ParsedArray arrayElement = ParsedArray.create();
1307
1308                    for (Object item : List.copyOf(objects)) {
1309                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(item);
1310                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1311                            arrayElement.add(subElement);
1312                        }
1313                    }
1314
1315                    return arrayElement;
1316                }
1317                case Map<?, ?> map -> {
1318                    ParsedObject objectElement = ParsedObject.create();
1319
1320                    for (Map.Entry<?, ?> entry : Map.copyOf(map).entrySet()) {
1321                        ParsedElement subElement = toElement(entry.getValue());
1322                        if (!((ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) || (ignoreEmptyObjects && (subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0)))) {
1323                            objectElement.set(toString(entry.getKey()), subElement);
1324                        }
1325                    }
1326
1327                    return objectElement;
1328                }
1329                default -> {
1330                    ParsedObject objectElement = ParsedObject.create();
1331
1332                    Object defaultObject = null;
1333                    if (ignoreDefaults) {
1334                        try {
1335                            defaultObject = InitializationUtil.initialize(object.getClass());
1336                        } catch (InitializationException e) {
1337                            if (BJSL.getLogger() != null) {
1338                                BJSL.getLogger().warning("Initialization of " + object.getClass().getSimpleName() + " failed, defaults will not be ignored");
1339
1340                                StringWriter stringWriter = new StringWriter();
1341                                PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(stringWriter);
1342                                e.printStackTrace(writer);
1343                                BJSL.getLogger().warning(stringWriter.toString());
1344                            }
1345                        }
1346                    }
1347
1348                    List<Field> fields = getFields(object.getClass());
1349                    for (Field field : fields) {
1350                        if (!Modifier.isStatic(field.getModifiers()) && (field.canAccess(object) || field.trySetAccessible())) {
1351                            boolean shouldSerialize = !(Modifier.isTransient(field.getModifiers()) || field.getName().startsWith("this$"));
1352
1353                            String subKey = field.getName();
1354                            ParsedElement subElement = toElement(field.get(object));
1355
1356                            if (ignoreNulls && (subElement.isPrimitive() && subElement.asPrimitive().isNull())) {
1357                                shouldSerialize = false;
1358                            }
1359
1360                            if (ignoreEmptyObjects && ((subElement.isObject() && subElement.asObject().getSize() == 0) || (subElement.isArray() && subElement.asArray().getSize() == 0))) {
1361                                shouldSerialize = false;
1362                            }
1363
1364                            if (ignoreDefaults && (subElement.isPrimitive() && (!subElement.asPrimitive().isNull() ? subElement.asPrimitive().get().equals(field.get(defaultObject)) : field.get(defaultObject) == null))) {
1365                                shouldSerialize = false;
1366                            }
1367
1368                            for (Annotation annotation : field.getDeclaredAnnotations()) {
1369                                if (annotation.annotationType() == AlwaysSerialize.class) {
1370                                    shouldSerialize = true;
1371                                } else if (annotation.annotationType() == NeverSerialize.class) {
1372                                    shouldSerialize = false;
1373                                } else if (annotation.annotationType() == Rename.class) {
1374                                    subKey = ((Rename) annotation).value();
1375                                }
1376                            }
1377
1378                            if (shouldSerialize) {
1379                                objectElement.set(subKey, subElement);
1380                            }
1381                        }
1382                    }
1383
1384                    return objectElement;
1385                }
1386            }
1387        } catch (Exception e) {
1388            throw new ProcessorException(e);
1389        }
1390    }
1391
1392    /**
1393     * Maps this primitive Object into a {@link java.lang.String}
1394     *
1395     * @param object The object to map
1396     *
1397     * @return A new {@link java.lang.String} with the value of the object
1398     *
1399     * @throws io.github.kale_ko.bjsl.processor.exception.ProcessorException If there is an exception while processing
1400     * @since 2.0.0
1401     */
1402    protected @NotNull String toString(@Nullable Object object) {
1403        try {
1404            ParsedElement element = toElement(object);
1405
1406            if (element.isPrimitive()) {
1407                ParsedPrimitive primitive = element.asPrimitive();
1408
1409                return primitive.toString();
1410            } else {
1411                throw new NotAPrimitiveException(element);
1412            }
1413        } catch (ProcessorException e) {
1414            throw e;
1415        } catch (Exception e) {
1416            throw new ProcessorException(e);
1417        }
1418    }
1419
1420
1421    /**
1422     * Get all the fields on a class and its superclasses
1423     *
1424     * @param clazz The class to get the fields of
1425     * @param <T>   The class to get the fields of
1426     *
1427     * @return All the fields on the class and its superclasses
1428     *
1429     * @since 1.0.0
1430     */
1431    protected static <T> @NotNull List<Field> getFields(@NotNull Class<T> clazz) {
1432        Set<String> fieldNames = new HashSet<>();
1433        List<Field> fields = new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(clazz.getDeclaredFields()));
1434
1435        Class<?> superClazz = clazz.getSuperclass();
1436        if (superClazz != null && superClazz != Object.class) {
1437            List<Field> superFields = getFields(superClazz);
1438
1439            for (Field superField : superFields) {
1440                boolean overwritten = fieldNames.contains(superField.getName());
1441
1442                if (!(overwritten || Modifier.isTransient(superField.getModifiers()))) {
1443                    fieldNames.add(superField.getName());
1444                    fields.add(superField);
1445                }
1446            }
1447        }
1448
1449        return fields;
1450    }
1451}
